alert.note: Alert for Napa; Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 5:43AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Napa and Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 845 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 543 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.2 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Napa, Petaluma, Novato, Rohnert Park, Windsor, American Canyon, Healdsburg, Sonoma, Cloverdale, Sebastopol, Cotati, St. Helena, Calistoga, Larkfield-Wikiup, Roseland, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Boyes Hot Springs, Black Point-Green Point and Forestville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
